info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 4:43AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms capable of producing very heavy rain and small hail will impact Pueblo and eastern Fremont counties through 515 AM MDT... At 440 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Pueblo county moving rapidly northwest at 55 mph. HAZARD...Locally very heavy rain, and winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain will cause ponding over water on roadways. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Salt Creek and Blende around 450 AM MDT. Pueblo around 455 AM MDT. Pueblo Reservoir around 500 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pueblo West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
